intro: Buchtienia ecuadorensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorian buchtienia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and distinctive, palmate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Buchtienia ecuadorensis is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in moist, shaded habitats within montane forests.
